page.title: 07Newington Grounds Vineyard
page.content: Newington Grounds Vineyard was planted at {Newington Grounds Farm} in 1977. The owner used Muller Thuigan ines. The wine was known as {Banbury {Cross}but in November 1981 the vineyard changed hands. The present owners produced 1800 bottles of a young crisp fruity wine for their 1983 vintage under the name of {'Newington Grounds'}. They are expecting about 2000 bottles in 1985. he vineyard has been going 8 years. The owners hope to plant another acre of land so that they can have some more bottles for 1987. The house is about 100 years old and is still in good condition. In the winter they have trouble getting up the track so they take their landrover down the track and the car everywhere else. Llyneth Gelling
